thread.title: California Living invites you to Sonoma for a Hitchcock 'Birds' movie scene tour
thread.title_full: California Living invites you to Sonoma for a Hitchcock 'Birds' movie scene tour | Examiner.com

author: Aprilanne Hurley
title: California Living invites you to Sonoma for a Hitchcock 'Birds' movie scene tour
text:
Play California Living® invites you to check out the Hitchcock Truffaut Documentary Movie Trailer and get ready to experience the California Living® "Birds Movie Scene Tour" in beautiful Sonoma County California. Top Documentaries Amidst the excitement of an Oct. 19, 2015 Flavorwire.com review of the Hitchcock /Truffaut Documentary based on Director Kent Jones book penned while Hitchcock's ' The Birds " movie was in post production, California Living ® airs the California Living® Hitchcock Bird’s Movie Scene Tour Sonoma travel special on ION Television in the San Francisco and Sacramento markets on Thursday, Oct. 22, 2015. Produced to educated and entertain Hitchcock movie fans and “Birds movie” buffs for years to come, the California Living® Birds Movie Scene Tour virtually transports viewers to all the major filming locations in Sonoma California, including Bodega Bay , California and the small town of Bodega, California made famous by Hitchcock’s 1960’s thriller “The Birds.” Jam-packed with Hitchcock “Birds” trivia, viewers are also treated to an inside look at the unique filming techniques used by Hitchcock considered quite advanced for his time.
Public Domain To plan your “Birds movie” Sonoma Coast getaway, California Living® recommends watching Alfred Hitchcock’s “The Birds” movie, and catching the California Living® Birds Movie Scene Tour Sonoma travel special prior to your trip to familiarize yourself with the major filming sites you will want to include on your “Birds movie” tour agenda. The California Living® Birds Movie Scene Tour in Sonoma County includes an overview of the unique inland town of Bodega, California. While many people refer to the filming site of Hitchcock’s “Birds” movie to be in Bodega Bay, California, the small town of Bodega is home to the famous Potter School and St. Teresa's Church, two of the most well known Bird's movie filming sites. This Inside Look TV Sonoma travel special also covers:
A visit to the UC Davis Bodega Marine Lab – former location of Mitch’s ranch in the “Birds.” Behind the scenes look at the Tide’s Wharf & Restaurant– a major filming location in Hitchcock’s thriller “The Birds.” An insider’s guide to the Sonoma filming sites Hitchcock used to create special scenes such as the famous children running from Potter School House scene. A selection of researched "Birds" movie trivia insights at the various filming sites around California’s Sonoma Coast. Now while both the town of Bodega and Bodega Bay are just about an hour north over the Golden Gate Bridge and can make a perfect day-trip for San Francisco Bay Area locals, those looking to make it a “Birds weekend” or weekday getaway are encouraged to check out California Living's "where to stay & play" in Bodega Bay, California. This Sonoma California travel spotlight shares an inside look at The Bodega Bay Lodge & Spa – considered the #1 lodging choice in Bodega Bay, California, by Trip Advisor® .
INSIDE LOOK TV, LLC & California Living® extend a special thank you to The Bodega Bay Area Chamber of Commerce (BBACC) for working with us to bring viewers this incredible behind the scenes look at the filming locations of Hitchcock’s thriller the “Birds” that made Bodega Bay, California famous. For more information on Bodega Bay, California log on to: VisitBodegaBayCA.com - your #1 Official resource for information on events, lodging and businesses in Bodega Bay, California.
California Living® airs Tuesday & Thursday Mornings @ 6:30 a.m. on ION Television’s KKPX-TV 65/Comcast 16 in San Francisco - Oakland - San Jose, California and on KSPX-TV Channel 29/Comcast Channel 11 in Sacramento, California. Check your local TV Guide listings for additional ION Television channel placements on Dish and Direct TV in your area.
